metadata.title: CVE-2017-15408 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in Omnibox in Google Chrome prior to 63.0.3239.84allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted PDF file that is mishandled by PDFium.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15408` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1').
